isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - BENDIX E6-TREADLE AND E7-SUSPENDED PEDAL TYPE (FOOT) BRAKE VALVES - MAINTENANCE

step1.para: Clean any accumulated dirt, gravel or foreign matter away from heel of treadle valve, plunger boot and mounting plate.

Lubricate plunger, roller, roller pin and hinge pin with Fleetrite EP2 Moly grease or equivalent to NLGI #2 multi-purpose lithium grease. Check rubber plunger boot for cracks, holes or deterioration and replace if required.
Free pedal travel should be checked to be sure plunger is in contact with spring seat, and adjust the stop button so that the roller and plunger just contact.
Every year or 100,000 miles (160,000 km) disassemble the brake valve. Clean and inspect all parts; install new parts where they are found to be worn or damaged.
